column1: '''''War of Words: Soldier-Poets of the Somme''''' is a documentary, first aired on [[BBC
column2: BBC Two]] on [[15 November]] [[2014]] as part of the centenary anniversary of [[World War I]].

column1: The documentary features vignettes on poets who fought in the [[Battle of the Somme]]: [[wikipedia:Siegfried Sassoon
column5: Isaac Rosenberg]] and [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. Tolkien's vignette, with commentary from [[John Garth]], recounts his involvement in the battles around Thiepval Wood. It also highlights the influences the war had on the [[Fall of Gondolin]], the [[Dead Marshes]], and the eternal conflict of good versus evil.
